summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that Government Exhibit 551 (AT&T telephone billing records) is authentic and admissible, and that the stipulation itself (Exhibit 1001) may be received as evidence at trial.

events.title: Stipulation on Evidence Authenticity
events.description: The prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case file a joint stipulation agreeing that AT&T telephone billing records (Government Exhibit 551) are authentic business records and that the stipulation itself (Exhibit 1001) is admissible at trial.

keyFacts: The prosecution and defense jointly stipulated to the authenticity of AT&T telephone billing records (Government Exhibit 551) as business records.
The stipulation itself was designated as Government Exhibit 1001 and agreed to be admissible as evidence at trial.
The document confirms the ongoing pretrial evidence authentication process in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330) as of November 2021.
Ghislaine Maxwell was represented by a legal team of at least four attorneys: Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
Damian Williams was serving as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York prosecuting the case.
